column3: I think it would help review if the bugfix came with a test case that failed before the fix
utACK 2cc733d, agree with Marco. Not sure about the TODO comment, maybe something like "// Local address reachability must be at least REACH_DEFAULT (1)"
Neither the commit message nor the PR explain the motivation for the change. It isn't self apparent.

I have some concern that this might make the behaviour incorrect?\n\nSay you only have a RFC1918 address because you have a port forward but don't know your external IP (e.g. not running the UPNP security hole...).   https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/src/net.cpp#L181   calls GetLocalAddress, which calls GetLocal, which only finds your RFC1918 address, which is REACH_UNREACH https://

> I have some concern that this might make the behaviour incorrect?\n> \n> Say you only have a RFC1918 address because you have a port forward but don't know your external IP (e.g. not running the UPNP security hole...). [/src/net.cpp@`master`#L181](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/src/net.cpp#L181) calls GetLocalAddress, which calls GetLocal, which only finds your RFC1918 address,
